text: Hi everyone :slightly_smiling_face: I'm a front-end dev / digital marketer at a large tech startup. Taking over a lot of our HubSpot development and operations but totally new to the platform

Yea I was surprised at how many when I just popped in here haha
Yea, it’s a pretty rapidly growing community
is it possible to have a card design for the recents posts instead of a unordered list?
this would be on the listing page
Yes it’s possible, Yes you will need to use a custom module, or in your case since it’s the listing page, just loop through contents or use `blog_recent_posts` and loop through that
ok thanks

We’re working on a fix
thanks!

Hi Everyone, As a super admin, i created a new user to my company and gave him limited access, The new user with limited access get logged in to his account successfully and requested me a bit more access. I updated the access to that user. But that user can't access those pages until he logs out and login again. Why is it so? Why not it should be like when i update access/permission, he get the access on page refresh?

hey <@UHHRS0EJ1>, to speed up delivery of app content, we cache a fair amount of stuff that we don’t expect to change frequently.  Permissions is one of those things that doesn’t change all that much so we can cache it so we don’t have to make an extra round trip to our server every time.  Logging in and out will prompt us to do a full check hence why it works there and not just on a refresh.
Okay. So it is kind of thing related to high loading speed for the end user. Thanks
Hello, I'm having trouble align bullets in my table, specifically, in Outlook. I can use inline-block for css but that code doesn't transfer to outlook.  Can some please supply recommendations?
my response in your other thread <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/CDSFETF5X/p1554847251060900>
